summary: In this context, ethylbenzene is mentioned as one of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) included in a list of chemicals used for analytical purposes in the determination of trihalomethanes (THMs) and BTEX in soils. Ethylbenzene, along with other solvents like toluene and benzene, is categorized under chemicals purchased for the study, indicating its role as a chemical analyte rather than highlighting any specific interaction or functional relationship with other chemicals.
